gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Sinkhole inventory for southern Indiana and northern Kentucky: Indiana, 2011

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This point shapefile was created to display in a geographic information system (GIS) mapped and modeled (indirectly mapped) sinkhole locations in southern Indiana and Kentucky.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This data set was created to support a statistical regression analysis of potential sinkhole development areas in and around the Hoosier National Forest, United States Forest Service. This data layer was used as the basis for a related layer of sinkhole density, as well as a sinkhole-development risk layer.

These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the- ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Prediction of potential areas of sinkhole development in southwestern Indiana using multiple regression analysis

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS version 10 (build 3600) shapefile format, Windows 7, approximately 20.0 MB

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: data collection date

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: A small number of points are located in northern Tennessee and have been retained because they were contained in the same database as the Kentucky point locations.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Checks for duplicates (unique values in unique records) were performed on this data set. No checks on topology were performed on this data set.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Checks for duplicates (unique values in unique records) were performed on this data set. No checks on topology were performed on this data set.

All fields were checked to ensure that all records were populated. Only sinkhole locations from the sources and methods used in the lineage section below were included in this database. Indirect methods were used to infer locations of many sinkholes, described in the process steps below. Sinkholes were not routinely identified (other than sparse GPS measurements) at scales below 1:12K.

Sinkhole locations provided by external sources were not routinely checked, with the exception of those from Taylor and Nelson, 2008, which were compared to similar indirect mapping methods used in the digital line graph (DLG) contour-extraction methodology of mapping sinkholes. UTM X and Y coordinates represent the horizontal accuracy of the source data set.

Accuracy is no better than that of the source material used to compile SINKHOLE_INVENTORY_IN_KY_2011.SHP. The horizontal accuracy varies from 1:2,400 to 1:300,000 (2 to 150 m), with the predominant accuracy of the sinkhole polygon centroids being between 10 and 12 meters.
Vertical accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of the data set. No quantitative tests were performed.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Closed contours were extracted from digital line graph (contour) data. The contours were converted to polygons. The polygons were filtered by size, and only those less than 10 acres in size were retained.The polygon centroid (inside) was used for the sinkhole location.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Using the digital elevation data from the 2005 Orthophotography Project, the 5-meter data was resampled to 10-meters using a bilinear interpolation. A fill process was then conducted in ArcGIS v 9.3 to create a surface with no internal depressions. The surface was subtracted from the original topographic surface to identify sinks. The aggregated cells representing sinkholes were converted to polygons and the polygon centroid (inside) was used for the sinkhole location.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Color infrared orthophotography was used to develop some validation data points for the project. Visual inspection of the images was used to identify sinkholes and assign a point location to the center of the feature. Points were mapped in Morgan, Orange, and Perry Counties, Indiana.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The following data sets in the lineage section above were acquired and converted to point locations in ArcGIS v. 9.3: Brock and others, 1973; HNF_restricted, IGS dye points named sinks, and Monroe County, Indiana, Surveyor (Enright).

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Data aquired from Taylor and Nelson, 2008, were imported by 8-digit hydrologic unit code (HUC) basin folder from an external hard drive with data from Charles Taylor. Within each folder was a database called karstdata.mdb. Each basin's database had a feature class called sinkpoint.shp (points) or sinkpoly.shp (polygons). All point files were merged; all polygon files were merged. The centroid of each polygon was extracted and joined to the sinkpoint data to represent sinkholes in Kentucky, Indiana (lesser), and Tennessee (few).

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: For each individual data set, the files were projected to UTM NAD 1983, Zone 16. The "merge" command was implemented in ArcGIS v. 9.3 to combine the data sets. A tool called "Delete Identical" was used to remove identical data points. These were common between the sinkholes derived from DLG closed contour extraction and the Taylor and Nelson, 2008, data, which used the same methods. The same analysis was conducted to remove coincident points derived from DEM analysis. Data points believed to represent the same feature, but not identical because of source scale or projection problems, were also filtered so that only one of the points was retained.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The attribute table for SINKHOLE_INVENTORY_IN_KY_2011.shp was modified to include an attribute called SOURCE to identify the source or method of determining the point locations.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Modeled sinkhole locations from terrain processing in geographic information system software

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Elev05_DEMIMGSPW_IN: Digital Elevation Model of Indiana (DEM, Indiana State Plane West, 2005, Erdas Imagine Files)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Publication date
This data set was used to extract closed contours representing depressions. The data were further filtered by size and location.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: CONTOURS_24K_USGS_XX.shp: Elevation Contours from 7.5-Minute Topographic Quadrangle Maps (Indiana)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Publication date
Sinkhole locations in Monroe County, Indiana. Note: This is not a complete inventory; project-based.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: pkarst83.shp and skarst27_to_83.shp: point shapefiles of sinkhole points in Monroe County, Indiana.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Publication date
Remotely mapped sinkhole locations by visual inspection of color infrared imagery for Monroe, Perry, and Orange Counties, Indiana

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: ORTHOS05_CIRDOQQTifUTM_IN: Orthophotography of Indiana (color infrared 1 meter resolution, UTM Zone 16N, 2005, TIFF Files)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Publication date
Sinkhole locations in Monroe and Lawrence Counties, Indiana.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Absence of Obligately Psychrophilic Bacteria in Constantly Cold Springs Associated with Caves in Southern Indiana

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Brock, T. D., Passman, F., and Yoder, I.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Publication date
Named sinkholes in Greene, Harrison, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, and Orange Counties.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: KARST_DYE_PTS_IN: Input and Detection Points for Selected Subsurface Dye Traces in Southern Indiana

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Data collection date
Sinkhole polygons for Kentucky, Indiana, and Tennessee

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: A compilation of provisional karst geospatial data for the Interior Low Plateaus physiographic region, central United States: U.S. Geological Survey Data Series 339

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Taylor, C. J., and Nelson Jr., H. L.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Publication date

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.
